answers.answer: Steroids cause weight gain that is difficult to lose.  I don't know of any specific treatment other than aggressive diet/exercise.  Of course would check thyroid function.

I am having a similar experience.  I had 2 rounds of steroid injections in my neck and back in May and June.  I was 140 at the beginning and now 158.  I am also newly diagnosed hypothyroid.  I haven't been eating the best in the world but I'm not pigging out either.  It seems that any little thing I eat shows up on the scale the next day.  It's discouraging to read your story because it's appears you're doing everything right.  I don't hold out much hope for me.

I was on high dose steriods for almost two years(considered toxic for most), steriods not only cause weight gain, which I experienced, it can also induce diabetes(which happened to me).  Please make sure to have yourself checked for diabetes also.

question: Since the beginning of April I have been on Steroids three times orally and once was given intravenus steroids in the hospital when ITP required that I have a platelet transfusion.  I have been off the last dose for about two months.  Here's the problem, I have gained a total of 25 pounds with the last 10 in the past two months.  My Hematologist tested and says that my thyroid is within normal limits as of a few months ago.  I have been dieting (eating 5 times a day, about 1500 cals) and working out 5 days a week.  I have not lost one single pound and I'm on my fourth week.  This is the first time in my life I have not had control of how my body is responding to diet and exercise.  Do you have any suggestions such as seeing an Endocrinelogists?  Is it possible that my body is battling within itself with the ITP and hanging on to everything it can...including weight?  I know this sounds ridiculous but I'm at a loss what else it can be or what I can do!
title: Problems after three rounds of Steroids
